data.title: Have RALint check map.yaml files
data.body: so we don't ship crashy maps with custom rules because of YamlExceptions that slip through.

data.title: Rewrite sprite handling.
data.body:
This introduces a common interface for sprite parsers and a utility class which identifies the type by inspecting the data.  The sequence and terrain code now use the common interface and lose their special-case hacks.

The main improvements are:
- shp(td)/shp(ts)/shp(d2)/r8/tmp(td)/tmp(ra) are supported for both terrain and sequences.
- OpenRA.Utility --png supports all of the above, and now generates a set of frames instead of a strip.
- OpenRA.Utility --shp takes a set of frames instead of a strip.
- Kills the pile of hacks that previously supported .r8 and shp(ts).
- Significantly simplifies adding additional sprite types in the future.

This _should_ be relatively low risk, as any errors (wrong filetype identification being the main one) would trigger a crash at the loadscreen.  There isn't a lot of room for subtle errors to live the sprite plumbing.

data.title: Remove language selector and IRC chat from the visible game UI.
data.body:
Both of these features need a significant amount of work before they are release-ready. These features are currently doing more harm than good by blocking the other fixes and improvements from making their way into a new release.

I have made a start on fixing IRC, but that will not be ready in the near future.

Of course, both of these features can be restored once they have seen more polishing.

data.title: Auto-completion for nicknames and console commands
data.body:
It would be cool to have auto-completion in OpenRA.

Mockup with a poping menu:
![auto-completion2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/1844816/9d8e52d6-7555-11e3-87ac-a10a06946447.gif)

~~Example for /InstantBuildSpeed:
https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/1620278/9cb354da-5672-11e3-9f41-fe18a8867a0c.gif~~

**Nicknames**
In IRC (and in some other games too), you can press the TAB key to auto-complete a nickname. But the TAB key is not available (it currently switches Team/Global chat).

kyrreso suggested in #4173 that a new hotkey should be found to do that.
I suggest to simply implement auto-completion by default.

OpenRA could "monitor" what a player is typing and after the three first characters typed, the nickname would be automatically completed.

If two players have similar nicknames (Pedro44 and Pedronator for example), then the player would have to continue typing characters until they differ before auto-completion starts.

**Console Commands**
Same for Console Commands #4131

data.title: wish: tab completion on chat
data.body: In game lobby and ingame in chat, tab completion of usernames would be nice.. But it should also help us, so (unicode)#¤)(#¤)MATERIA#¤#¤ can be written with mat(keyboard up) or similar. Tab button is used ingame, so we should find another

data.title: wish: * on option button when option for a map is changed
data.body: When options for the game is changed, the button should flash/get a star in the title/change color. Then you can press it to see whats changed.

data.title: Thought: What if SOME buildings had a build radius?
data.body:
Well I personally feel that building husks are the best option, the radius is acceptable.

Well anyway, I had this random thought. What if SOME buildings besides the con yard had a build radius? Expensive long-build time ones like the War Factory?

Maybe a smaller radius then the CY.

Buildings that might have a build radius:
War Factory
Dome
Tech Center

I mean, I guess you could still spam these if you had a team, one person builds a Dome while the other guy power plants to the edge of the build radius.

I just thought it and had to bring it up, always good to share ideas even if they might not work because maybe they could be used for something else.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1334991-thought-what-if-some-buildings-had-a-build-radius?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.title: Red Alert Chrome YAML Translations
data.body: all non-hardcoded strings should be translatable now.

data.title: Minor fixes to yet unused artwork
Map Chooser Sorting options
data.body:
I could be interesting to add Sorting Options for the map chooser.
For example: 
- sort by the number of times a map has been played
- sort by map name
- sort by author
- sort by map rating
- sort by the number of players the map is made for

![e676966](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/3489544/773605c8-0535-11e4-8877-9be253db2d50.gif)

For the map rating system, maybe it could be done online at http://content.open-ra.org/ ? (ihptru is making a new version of his website).

For the 'number of times a map has been played', maybe the server could record statistics based on players' choices, ingame.

I think helicopter blades should blend with the helicopter body.

Here you can find my exception.log:

http://pastebin.com/R9BDdqyf

And the last lines of perf.log:

Thanks in advance!

data.title: AI drop-down menu more visible (RA)
data.body:
The recent changes on this drop-down menu made it almost perfect (talking about ease of use) but the RA red theme sometimes makes things hard to recognize.

What if the whole UI got darker as soon as drop-down menus are used ?
This would help the player focus on the menu choices.

![uidarker_dropdownmenu](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/1580060/3d20bbf4-51b1-11e3-930c-25db4202ffdb.gif)
